_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: Addition of tank, compressor, associated piping
_prev_prog_3.Description: The NGL Supply Terminal Company, West Vancouver terminal is located at 5701 N.W. Old Lower River Rd., Vancouver, WA.  This facility provides for the transfer of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) under pressure from stationary (detached from locomotive) pressure tank/rail cars to stationary above ground storage tanks.  Product is moved to storage tanks using a fixed rail car unloading system via pressure differential, and pumped from storage tanks to transport trucks and trailers using liquid transfer pumps.  A Process Safety Management program has been prepared and implemented at the terminal.  This program uses a systematic approach to evaluate the whole process.    Various emergency shutdown and backup lines of defense have been incorporated in the design and operation of the process to prevent or mitigate the release of LPG.  The facility began operations February 2011 and was built with new systems.  Every five years or sooner if warranted, processes will be evaluated and strengthened where required to assure their effectiveness.  NGL Supply Terminal Company has developed standard operating procedures that provide clear instructions for safely conducting activities involved in the covered process consistent with the process safety information.  Operating procedures for the process will be reviewed by the Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) team, engineering staff, and operating personnel to ensure that they are accurate and provide practical instructions on how to actually carry out job duties safely.  NGL Supply Terminal Company has developed and implemented an emergency action plan to facilitate the prompt response, notification and evacuation of employees due to an unwanted release of LPG.  The site emergency planning and response procedures describe the actions to be taken by all responding personnel to potential emergency situations at the NGL Supply Terminal Company West Vancouver terminal.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the West Vancouver Terminal facility:



NGL Supply Terminal Company is committed to the safety of its workers, the public, and the environment. Its accidental release policy is an integrated approach, involving employee participation, management practices, written procedures, and training. NGL has developed a comprehensive Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) accident prevention program considering all aspects of process operation and maintenance. The accident prevention program includes compliance with ongoing mechanical integrity inspections, which includes the API RP 510 Pressure Vessel Inspection Program and API RP 570 Piping Inspection Program.  In addition, the facility conducts 3 year PSM Compliance Audits.  If an emergency were to occur, it is NGL's policy to notify the City of Vancouver Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency. The Vancouver Terminal also maintains incipient stage firefighting equipment on site. Additionally, the facility has been equipped with fire suppression cannon nozzles along the facility perimeter. This facility complies with NFPA-58 requirements for LP-Gas storage, and it is NGL's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws. The facility came online new in 2011 and is annually inspected for compliance by the City of Vancouver. 



A description of the West Vancouver Terminal facility and the regulated substances handled: 



This facility is a bulk terminal storing LPG for resale to retail butane and propane dealers. The facility consists of two 80,000-gallon tanks holding approximately 290,000 pounds each of liquid propane and one 75,000 gallon tank holding approximately 330,000 lbs of liquid butane. There is also the capacity for sixteen 33,000-gallon rail cars onsite and capacity for another six 33,000-gallon rail cars adjacent to the facility on leased property. There are both manual and automatic emergency shutdown systems

on all LPG equipment at the site.



The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:



This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule, the OSHA PSM standard, and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. The LPG system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA-58 and state law.



Five-year accident history:



The terminal facility began operations in February 2011. There has not been an accident involving LPG that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or any shelter in-place. 



The emergency response program:



In the event of an emergency involving the Vancouver Terminal's LPG system, it is NGL's policy to notify the City of Vancouver Fire Department and request help in responding to the emergency. NGL also has trained employees in incipient stage firefighting. The Vancouver Terminal has coordinated the facility's response plans with the fire department; members of the fire department have been provided the opportunity to visit the Vancouver Terminal facility and inspect the LPG storage system.



Planned changes to improve safety:



NGL Supply Terminal Company, LLC will continually strive for safety improvement. Periodic process safety inspections and Process Hazard Analyses will be conducted followed with timely response.
